ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: in this physics, i learned basic mechanics. i hate to be trite, but the course isn't that magical or revolutionary. if you're signing up for this class, then you should know you are signing up for something unremarkable, though likely useful to your future studies, assuming the average person shopping this class has some intention of taking further courses in physics or engineering.
I developed a more comprehensive understanding of several concepts in Physics.

This is one of the best courses I have taken at Yale, and Professor Mehdi was just exceptional in teaching, guiding, and support. Would have loved to take another class with him this summer. I loved the time in Physics 180 and very grateful for the knowledge gained.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It's pretty chaotic relative to the other intro science courses. Office hours were difficult to access a lot of the time, and the TAs were mostly useless. Discussion sections were also kind of a joke.

Strengths:
- Great professor
Weakness:
- a little too fast paced
Perhaps, have actual discussions and collaborations during the discussion sections -- it was useful for the TA to go over the quizzes, but I would have loved to work with my classmates.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This is such an average course. I wouldn't recommend taking it just because there are so many better courses you could take. But also if you are seeking to take this class, then you probably have some better reason for it.
Yes if you are interested in Physics and have time over summer.
Absolutely, any course with Professor Mehdi is a MUST to take at Yale.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: Not really at all--but that's sort of my fault. Originally thought I might pursue physics further at Yale, but decided by my own volition, regardless of this class, that it isn't an interest I'm really gonna follow. This class did nothing to change my mind, but I don't think it's designed to do so.
I am on a MechE track, and the knowledge I gained in this class will be fundamental. I am so grateful to Professor Mehdi for such a strong foundation.
I'll be taking more physics courses, possibly even majoring!
